comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
I believe there are now 12 tests that fail due to lack of a TTY.

We do not know how to fix this, it heavily involves the implementation of the `PSHost` (and its `UserInterface` and that's `RawUserInterface`).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@lzybkr perhaps you could help us out here. Do we need a "dumber" `PSHost` implementation specifically for the non-interactive use case? I had to tunnel through to our `RawUserInterface` in 9a5c010f54a26708a8c3615eb3c46e857978e702 to make our Pester tests run on AppVeyor.

What do the Windows hosts do for this kind of thing?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: I'm not sure how much help I can be w/o specifics, but I noticed one possible issue - new Size(0,0) seems like it has the potential to cause problems.  I'm guess we need to assume a non-zero width somewhere to decide how to wrap lines or whatever.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @lzybkr You were on the right track! As soon as we were able to revert our use of `WindowWidth/Height` back to `BufferWidth/Height`, these tests all started passing. Hurray for .NET Core getting updated.
